titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:25-0400

did.abstract: The major portion of this correspondence deals with the controversy which arose when Benjamin Peirce, after having seen the manuscript of Warner's "Studies in Organic Morphology" (Philadelphia, 1857), read a paper on morphology before the American Academy of Arts and Sciences (1855). Other topics discussed include the alleged "Harvard clique," the administration of the Dudley Observatory (Albany, N.Y.), and the United States Coast and Geodetic Survey.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 1944.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John Warner was an amateur mathematician and naturalist (d. 1873) who resided in Pottsville, Pennsylvania. He published on engineering subjects and organic morphology. He lived abroad from 1862 to 1868, visiting England, France, Italy, the Levant, Egypt, Greece, Constantinople, the Balkans, and Germany.

controlaccess.corpname: American Academy of Arts and Sciences.
controlaccess.subject: Morphology.
Science.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 255 pieces, manuscript. The collection consists of letters written to and from John Warner, the major portion of which deal with a controversy which arose when Benjamin Peirce, of Harvard, after having seen Mr. Warner's manuscript pertaining to organic morphology, read a paper on the subject before the Providence meeting of the AAAS, 1855. In addition to the chief topic, the Papers contain many comments on the "Harvard clique," its influence on the AAAS, a controversy involving the administration of the Dudley Observatory in Albany, and the U.S. Coast survey. For a complete list of the letters see Table of contents filed with the papers. Deposited by the Academy of natural sciences of Philadelphia, December 1944. Table of contents available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office, Sch[uylkill] Nav[igation] Co., A.L.S. 2p. Requests that an inventory be made of the cars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office, Sch[uylkill] Nav[igation] compy, A.L.S. 1p. and add. (Contains also draft of Warner's reply, Nov. 26,1850) Company matters relative to contracts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A. draft of L. 1p. (On same sheet with letter from Fraley to Warner, Nov. 23, 1850) Explains misunderstanding about the making of contracts [Schuylkill navigation company].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office, Sch[uylkill] Nav[igation] compy, A.L.S. 2p. and add. Company matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 3p. As directed will report to Mr. E.T. Warner. Report upon the use of the cars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 1p. Is informed by Mr. Fraley that he is the present head of the Car department; awaits instructions for service.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office, Sch[uylkill] Nav[igation] compy, A.L.S. 2p. and add. Company matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. Will be glad for the opportunity to discuss with him the dissatisfaction relative to his work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Office, Sch[uylkill] Nav[igation] co., A.L.S. 1p. and add. Dismissal from employ of the Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p. Cost of pipe. Family news.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Copy of L. 1p. (On Same sheet is letter from Agassiz to Sheafer, Feb. 22, 1853) Relative to fishes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cambridge, Copy of L. 1p. (On same sheet with letter from Agassiz to Sheafer, Feb. 14, 1853.) Desires to obtain specimens of fish from the different creeks in Sheafer's vicinity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Point, N.Y., A.L.S. 2p. Contains pencil notes by John Warner (?). Comments on Mr. Warner's mathematical studies; advice with respect to publishing same; mentions AAAS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Smithsonian inst. A.L.S. 2p. and enc. - 2p. Encloses report upon paper submitted to the Institution for publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, L.S. 2p. Relative to a paper submitted to the Smithsonian institution for publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.] A.L. 17p. Incomplete? Transmits a few hints which will enable him to understand his views in relation to the diagrams submitted to his inspection [re organic morphology].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, L.S. 1p. Relative to a manuscript submitted to the Smithsonian institution for publication

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delaware college, Newark, A.L.S. 1p. Comments upon Warner's mathematical researches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. and add. Comments upon a paper Mr. Warner submitted to him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nahant, Copy of L. - 2c. of 1p. each. (On same sheet with 2nd c. is letter from Benjamin Peirce to D. Washburn, July 16, 1857) Promises to return math. papers. Desires the different kinds of minnows of Sheafer's neighborhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to an article on anthracite sent for publication in the American mining chronicle, iron manufacturers' & railway journal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p. and add. Family news. Offers to help him to get established in some business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Walnut lane, A.L.S. 3p. Family news.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the publication of his article on the anthracite coal fields in the American mining chronicle, iron manufacturers' & railway journal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.] A.L.S. 4p. (Accompanied by ms. copy - 3p. and end.) In French Relative to curved lines. (Original signature confusing - might it be Charles Jules Felix de Comberousse, 1826-1897?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington,Ind. [i.e. 1857?]. A.L.S. 1p. Encloses document which he hopes will be satisfactory [Document is probably letter from Kirkwood to ---- Dec. 31, 1856 which was pasted to the above letter when received by the A.P.S.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. and add. Believes Mr. Warner is more fitted for scientific than mercantile pursuits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Newark, A.L.S. 1p. Comments on Warner's Organic morphology. Has accepted the professorship of mathematics in Indiana university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 1p. Mr. Warner's mathematical calculations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 5p. At Foulke's requests, describes his researches upon the properties of curved lines; mentions using the library of the American philosophical society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, Copy of L. 1p. (On same sheet is copy of Letter from J. Warner to L. Agassiz, Dec. 1, 1856) (3c. of each) Encloses a letter from Mr. Warner the author of a paper on forms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.L.S. 2p. (On same sheet with copy of letter from P.W. Sheafer to Agassiz, Dec. 1, 1856. Contains also notes by Warner relative to the correspondence) (3c. of each) Requests that he return the paper on organic forms sent him three years before

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L.S. 1p. Whereabouts of M. Combescure.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A. copy of L. S. 1p. and end. Desires to verify a date with reference to a certain paper Mr. Warner had submitted to the Smithsonian institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Orwigsburg [Pa.] A.L.S. 1p. Dates certain remarks by Prof. Henry as being made during the school convention in August 1853.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 1p. and end. Asks him to give a statement about his knowledge of Warner's researches in the organic generation of curves and the science of morphology.

scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. (copy of same) Conjectures as to how far he may be considered a pioneer in the science of organic morphology in this country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the distribution of his work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Writes on behalf of the overseers of the Monthly meeting of Friends of Philadelphia, of which Mr. Warner is a member, regarding his religious practices.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. States his religious principles upon the subject of a man made and a hireling ministry in contrast to the belief of the Society of Friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, A.L.S. 4p. Disagrees with Newton's philosophy. Gives Warner scientific advice. Moves to West Newton in May.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 3p. Mentions the Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. and add. Desires information about property deeded to the Friends by Burd Pattison about 1830.

scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.L.S. 1p. Replies to his letter relative to the meeting house property.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cincinnati, A.L.S. 1p. Printed enc. - 2p. Acknowledges receipt of his work on organic morphology. Sends a circular containing an announcement of some new views [addressed to the members of the AAAS].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. (Accompanied by copy - 2p.) A talk with a mutual friend about Warner's book on morphology has resulted in an invitation to prepare a paper to be read at the AAAS meeting in Springfield. Refers to Peirce- Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A. Dr. of L.S. 3p. and end. Relative to the possibility of a position for Mr. Warner with the Coast Survey. The Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p. Comments upon Mr. Warner's works.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p. Relative to the Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 4p. The Peirce-Warner controversy. Comments upon scientists of the day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 3p. Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 4p. The Dudley observatory controversy. The Cambridge professors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L. 2p. The Dudley observatory controversy; his own controversy with Prof. Peirce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 6p. The Dudley observatory controversy. Would like to see Mr. Warner in some good mathematical position.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 2p. Relative to the Dudley observatory controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 2p. The Dudley observatory. Peirce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 4p. His son. The Coast survey. Peirce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the sale of a house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 3p. Mentions several scientists of the day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p. Peirce-Warner controversy. Use of locomotives in coal mines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [ca.] A.L.S. with initials. 1p. (Only last page) The Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, A. copy of L.S. 1p. Encloses sketch showing where the gangway of the Forestville colliery crossed the east and north lines of the Bluw (?) Tract in 1856.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Muncy, A(?)L.S. 2p. Relative to a note which is due.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 8p. Warner's Organic Morphology; suggests publishing it in French for European circulation. Comments upon the Peirce controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 4p. Goes to Detroit to deliver his lecture on "Geology and the deluge." Questions possibility of giving it in other cities. The Dudley observatory controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, N.Y., [ca.]. A.L.S. 1p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the sale of a house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.L.S. 1p. Acknowledge receipt of the report of the survey of mines near the northwest corner of Phoenixville. Mentions the Pottsville scientific association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to a possible survey of the Phoenix lines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wien, Printed L.S: D. H(?) Schnatt---, general secretär. 1p. Acknowledges receipt of his Studies in organic morphology.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: K. sächsische gesellschaft der wissenschaften, Leipzig

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leipzig, Printed L.S: E. H. Weber, secretär. 1p. In German. Acknowledges receipt of his Studies in organic morphology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 6p. His present interest in a young seaman who is charged with murder. His philosophy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, A.L.S. 3p. Acknowledges his paper on earthwork which will appear in his Annual [of scientific discovery. Asks for a recommendation of his series of scientific school books. Refers to the Peirce-Warner controversy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the sale of his house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, N.Y., A.L.S. 4p. Appreciates Mr. Warner's efforts in his behalf. Sends a package of his books. Comments on scientists of the day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Schenectady, N.Y., A.L.S. 1p. Desires copy of Mr. Warner's work on earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, N.Y., A.L.S. 2p. Sends 12 sets of his books and a set of Gray's botanies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A. copy of L.S. 2p. and end. His work on earthwork now in the hands of a Philadelphia publisher. Is engaged in land and mine surveying.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 1p. and add. Acknowledges material on the Dudley observatory difficulty which he supposes came from Mr. Warner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 3p. Comments on scientists and their works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, A.L.S. 4p. Suggestions regarding the publication of Mr. Warner's Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Asks for correct address so that he may send the Book of Advices of the Society of Friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. Assures him that nothing will cool their friendship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Redwood farm, A.L.S. 2p. Family letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A.L.S. 1p. Probably a letterpress copy. Will be pleased to receive the Book of Advices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Smethport, A.L.S. 1p. Relative to the publication of Warner's Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Muncy, A.L.S. 1P. Relative to the purchase of the steam engine which Mr. Warner has for sale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A.L.S. 1p. Probably a letterpress copy. Relative to the sale of an engine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Schenectady, N.Y., A.L.S. 1p. Enters subscription for Mr. Warner's work on earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A.Dr. of L.S. 3p. Relative to the publication of his Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Relates to a work by Mr. Warner being published by Lippincott & co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.Dr. of L.S. 1p. Acknowledges a certain circular from the [smithsonian] institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 6p. Account of his efforts which saved Plumer (?) from the scaffold. Peirce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Averysborough N.C., A.L.S. 1p. Mr. Warner's Tables of earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. (Accompanied by another copy with a few additional notes) Relative to his Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Averysborough, N.C., A.L.S. 2p. Suggests that Mr. Warner try to interest B.H. Latrobe, the ablest living railroad engineer, in his recent work on earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 3p. Is now at home looking for another position.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Averysborough, A.L.S. 2p. Did his best to advance the interests of Schuylkill county by the promotion of the Allentown line.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 3p. Mr. Warner's new book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. Relative to his Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: West Newton, A.L.S. 3p. Sympathy on death of his uncle. Is deliberating on the idea of going to South America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 7p. Additional comments upon [Benjamin] Peirce. Dissensions among scientists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 6p. Philosophy of life. Mentions [John] Brown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p. Relative to the executorship of their uncle's estate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S: W.S. Washburn. Send proofs of his "Tables."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troy, A.L.S. 3p. Is busy with the publication of his Annual and text books; offers to publish any material for Mr. Warner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S: W. S. Washburn. 1p. Relative to his "Tables."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cape Fear River, N.C., A.L.S. 3p. Comments on negroes and the political situation of the South. publication of Warner's Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Will attempt to procure a copy of Rodger's Geology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, A.L.S. 1p. Letterpress (?) D.A. Wells is willing to go as high as $25 for a copy of Roger's Report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Minersville, A.L.S. 1p. In pencil. Desires to borrow a book on perspective.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, A.L.S. 1p. Letterpress. Mutilated and faded. Books on industrial drawing borrowed from Geo. K. Smith.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S: W. S. Washburn. 1p. Relative to his "Tables."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Woodside, Pa., A.Dr. of L.S. 3p. Encloses sample of his Tables, the printing of which is delayed for want of time to read proof.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 2p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pottsville, A.L.S. 2p. (Contains also a letter from Red to his brother, John Warner, Feb. 21, 1860)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. (on same sheet with letter from C. Loeser to J. Warner, Feb. 19,1860)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Buckhorn (?) canal, N.C., A.L.S. 1p. Is glad to hear of Warner's resolution to complete his Tables and book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Averysborough, N.C., A.L.S. 3p. Suggestions with regard to Mr. Warner's mathematical works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Smethport, A.L.S. 4p. Warner's Tables. His work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S. 5p. Glad that his new independence will allow him to cultivate his morphological pursuits. Winslow's studies relative to solar repulsion; Peirce's use of same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S. 3p. Encloses complimentary references of his work which Mr. Warner may use as he sees fit. Recommends Humboldt's letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Averysborough N.C., A.L.S. 1p. Suggestions relative to Mr. Warner's Tables.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 2p. Indiana politics; thinks Lincoln will get the state's vote.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S. 4p. Comments on Humboldt as a scientific scholar. Agassiz's new museum; Winslow's donation to it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S. 4p. Comments on Warner's present mathematical labors [Tables]. Comments on politics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comet Wells,Pa., A.L.S. 3p. Publication of Warner's Tables. Oil wells.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington,Ind., A.L.S. 3p. Suggests the possibility of having an A.M. degree awarded to Mr. Warner by the University. Indiana's views on secession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S. 6p. The South and the war. Comments on D.A. Wells' First principles of geology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 1p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S.: Daniel Kirkwood, secretary of the faculty. 1p. Announcement that the University has conferred upon him the honorary degree of Master of Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S: Robert C. Foster, secy. Ind. unty. 1p. Seal. Announcement that he has been admitted to the degree of Master of Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 1p. Comments on comet seen the night before.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 2p. Suggests the possibility of having his mathematical papers published in the Mathematical monthly. Disappointed in the results of the battle of Manassas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, A.L.S. 1p. Warner's paper on the hyperbola appears in the last Mathematical monthly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comet Wells, A.L.S. 2p. Asks his aid in securing a position with the Philadelphia and Erie R.R.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A. copy of L.S. 1p. Sends a copy of his book on earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comet Wells, A.L.S. 3p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Schenectady, N.Y., A.L.S. 3p. Comments upon Mr. Warner's work on earthwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bridgewater, Pa., A.Dr. of L. 4p. Thanks for his encouraging reception of his work [on earthwork]. Exchange of ideas on same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind., A.L.S. 2p. Comments on Warner's book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comet Wells, A.L.S. 1p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A. copy of L.S. 1p. Will leave the question of equivalent level heights until Prof. Gillespie has examined his comments upon the subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bloomington, Ind. A.L.S: Daniel Kirkwood, sec. of the faculty. 1p. Thanks for the box of models illustrative of Warner's Treatise on earthwork, presented by the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. Appreciation for the models presented by Mr. Warner. Will recommend his book.

did.unittitle: Letter to M. de Franqueville, Director of Ponts et Chaussées;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.Dr. of L.S. 2p. Is the author of a work and inventor of an instrument designed to assist the cubature of railroad excavations and embankments; submits these with the request that they be examined by the Commission des inventions de l'Ecole des ponts et chaussées.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.Dr. of L.S. 1p. and end. Thanks him for the trouble he has taken on Warner's behalf relative to his work on earthwork.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Minister of public works;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.Dr. of L. 1p. In pencil. Is the author of a work and inventor of an instrument designed to assist the cubature of railroad excavations and embankments; has left copies of his work and the instrument, and asks that they be given and examination by the Commission des inventions des Ponts et chaussées.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: France. Ministre de l'agriculture, du commerce et des travaux publics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, L.S: In French. In accordance with his request has transmitted his letter and invention to M. Avril, inspector general of Ponts et Chaussées.

did.abstract: These pocket-sized volumes detail Warner's travels through Europe, Asia, and parts of Africa, and include interesting sketches scattered throughout the volumes. The diaries from these travels also include 23 maps.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See Murphy D. Smith, "Historical American Sketches. An Illustrated Guide to Sketches in the Manuscript Collections of the American Philosophical Society" (Boston, 1984): 242-243.
